title: Foreign hiker detained at Delhi airport for carrying banned GPS device - Hindustan Times
summary:
Foreign hiker detained at Delhi airport for carrying banned GPS device

Date: Jan 03, 2025

Source: HT News Desk

A Scottish hiker, Heather, claimed that she was detained at Delhi airport for allegedly carrying a banned Garmin Inreach GPS device. She reported that security personnel informed her of the ban upon her passing through security.

  • Heather was detained on January 3, 2025, at Delhi airport for carrying a Garmin Inreach device.
  • She was informed that the device is banned in India and was subsequently handed over to police.
  • Heather recorded her experience in a video posted on Instagram.
  • Despite contacting her embassy, they could not intervene as she was under police custody.
  • After questioning, she was allowed to leave but must return for a court appearance.
  • A similar incident occurred with a Czech national in Goa for possessing a different banned GPS device.
“At 9pm, I was finally released from the police station, but I am required to return to attend court,” Heather stated.

This incident highlights ongoing issues regarding the carrying of specific technological devices into India and the need for awareness among travelers about local regulations.
newTitle: Foreign hiker detained at Delhi airport for carrying banned GPS device

'All Of Us Should Be Ashamed': Madras HC Says Anna University Sexual Assault Case Being Politicised - News18
summary:
Madras HC Condemns Politicization of Anna University Sexual Assault Case

Date: January 02, 2025 | Source: News18

In a recent statement, the Madras High Court expressed its dismay over the Anna University sexual assault case, indicating that the issue is being politicized rather than being addressed with genuine concern.

  • The Madras High Court criticized the police for mishandling the case and allowing politically motivated protests.
  • Justice P. Velmurugan expressed that the case should serve as a wake-up call about societal issues.
  • The incident involves the sexual assault of a 19-year-old engineering student on December 23, which has garnered significant media attention.
  • The court formed an all-women Special Investigation Team to investigate the case.
  • Interim compensation of ₹25 lakhs has been ordered for the survivor.
“All of us should be ashamed. Strictly speaking, we all are co-accused in such crimes.” - Justice P. Velmurugan

The court's remarks emphasize the need for serious societal reflection on attitudes towards gender and caste discrimination and the responsibilities of media and political entities in addressing such grave issues.
newTitle: Madras HC Condemns Politicization of Anna University Sexual Assault Case

Supreme Court slams ED 'high handedness', 'inhuman' 15-hour interrogation - The Times of India
summary:
Supreme Court slams ED 'high handedness', 'inhuman' 15-hour interrogation

Publication Date: October 16, 2023
Source: The Times of India

The Supreme Court of India has criticized the Enforcement Directorate for its excessive interrogation tactics, labeling a 15-hour session as 'inhuman' and reflecting on the rights of individuals during such investigations.

  • The ED's practices were described as high-handed.
  • The Supreme Court emphasizes the need for humane treatment during interrogations.
  • The ruling highlights the balance between law enforcement and individual rights.
"The treatment meted out is not in accordance with the law or natural justice principles." - Supreme Court Justice

This decision underscores the judiciary's role in regulating the methods employed by investigative agencies to uphold individual rights.
newTitle: Supreme Court Criticizes ED's Long Interrogation Tactics

title: Complete Vizag, Vijayawada metros within 4 years: Naidu - Deccan Chronicle
summary:
Complete Vizag, Vijayawada metros within 4 years: Naidu

Date: Recent Update | Source: Local News

Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu has urged for the swift completion of metro projects in Visakhapatnam and Vijayawada, aiming for a four-year timeline.

  • The Vijayawada Metro will span 66 km, while the Visakhapatnam Metro will reach 76.90 km.
  • Funding is based on the 2017 Metro Policy, which provides for 100% equity from the central government.
  • Naidu emphasized the need for discussions with the central government to align these projects with the Andhra Pradesh Reorganisation Act.
  • The proposed metro lines will utilize a double-decker model, allowing road traffic below the metro line.
“We must ensure that construction of the metros begins soon,” said Naidu.

In conclusion, the successful completion of these metro projects is crucial for urban development in Andhra Pradesh and will enhance transportation infrastructure in both cities.
newTitle: Complete Vizag, Vijayawada metros within 4 years: Naidu

title: Karnataka: Woman kills husband, smashes his face with stone, chops body - Hindustan Times
summary:
Woman Arrested for Murdering Husband, Disposing Body in Karnataka

Date: Jan 02, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

A woman in Karnataka's Belagavi was arrested for allegedly murdering her husband and chopping his body, police said on Thursday.

  • The woman allegedly strangled her 40-year-old husband, identified as Srimantha Itnali, and then smashed his face with a stone.
  • She cut his body into two pieces to dispose of it away from her house.
  • The incident took place on December 8, and the body was found on December 10 in Umarani village in Chikkodi taluk of Belagavi.
  • The police initially did not suspect the woman, but later brought her in for questioning, and she confessed to the crime.
  • The husband was reportedly a drunkard who abused his wife for money and wanted her to sell a piece of land to buy him a new motorbike.
"She first strangled him and when he was unconscious, used a boulder lying nearby to smash his face. She then disposed of the boulder in a well."

The woman has been taken into custody.
newTitle: Woman Arrested for Murdering Husband, Disposing Body in Karnataka

title: Government report reveals stark infrastructure gap in Indian schools - The Hindu
summary:
Government Report Highlights Infrastructure Gaps in Indian Schools

Date: January 02, 2025
Source: The Hindu

The latest report by the Unified District Information System for Education (UDISE+) reveals alarming gaps in infrastructure across Indian schools, with many lacking essential facilities like electricity, functional toilets, and access to computers.

  • Out of 14.71 lakh schools in India, 1.52 lakh have no functional electricity.
  • Only 67,000 schools operate without functional toilets, mainly affecting government schools.
  • Only 33.2% of government schools have disabled-friendly toilets, with fewer being functional.
  • 50% of all schools lack access to computers for educational purposes.
  • Only 10.5% of schools have implemented solar panel facilities.
  • Only 17.5% of schools have co-curricular activity rooms or arts and crafts facilities.
  • In government secondary schools, 50.2% have science laboratory facilities.
"The condition is much worse when it comes to providing disabled-friendly facilities, with only 33.2% of schools having disabled-friendly toilets."

This report underscores a significant need for improvement in the infrastructure of schools in India, especially for the government-run institutions.
newTitle: Government Report Highlights Infrastructure Gaps in Indian Schools

Article 370 caused spread of terrorism in Kashmir: Amit Shah - The Hindu
summary:
Amit Shah: Article 370 Fueled Terrorism in Kashmir

Published on: January 02, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Union Home Minister Amit Shah claims that Article 370 has played a critical role in fostering terrorism in Kashmir, attributing it to the notion of temporary relations between Kashmir and India.

  • Article 370 fostered separatism among Kashmiri youth, leading to terrorism.
  • Other Muslim-majority regions in India did not experience similar terrorism despite sharing borders with Pakistan.
  • Mr. Shah stated that the misconception of Kashmir's relationship with India promoted extremism.
  • The revocation of Article 370 on August 5, 2019, must be understood in the larger historical context.

“Why did terrorism not spread in other Muslim areas of the country? ... It is unfortunate that 40,000 people lost their lives,” Mr. Shah said.

The Home Minister further emphasized the importance of re-evaluating Kashmir's history and offered perspectives that could reshape national narratives.
newTitle: Amit Shah: Article 370 Fueled Terrorism in Kashmir

title: 'Kya bol rahe hain?': Bihar CM Nitish Kumar reacts to Lalu's INDIA bloc invite - The Times of India
summary:
'Kya bol rahe hain?': Bihar CM Nitish Kumar reacts to Lalu's INDIA bloc invite

Publication date: Not specified Source: Times of India

In a surprising turn of events, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar publicly responded to an invitation extended by Lalu Prasad Yadav regarding the INDIA bloc, stirring political discussions across the state.

  • Nitish Kumar remarked, 'Kya bol rahe hain?' in response to Lalu's invitation.
  • The exchange highlights ongoing political tensions and strategies within Bihar.
  • Speculations about potential political alignments and future coalition formations in the region arise.
'Kya bol rahe hain?' - Nitish Kumar

This scenario underscores the complex political dynamics at play in Bihar's current landscape as leaders align with the INDIA bloc entities.
newTitle: 'Kya bol rahe hain?': Bihar CM Nitish Kumar reacts to Lalu's INDIA bloc invite

title: Delhi On Yellow Alert Tomorrow; Noida Schools Shut For Classes Up To 8 'Until Further Orders'-See Forecast - Times Now
summary:
Noida Schools Closed Due to Cold Wave; Delhi on Yellow Alert for Smog

Publication Date: January 3, 2025

Source: Times Now

The India Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert for dense smog in Delhi, coinciding with the closure of Noida schools for classes up to 8 due to harsh weather conditions.

  • Noida schools up to Class 8 remain closed due to harsh weather conditions.
  • Delhi on yellow alert for dense smog, with fog and cold wave sweeping North India.
  • IMD forecasts more cold days for northern and central India throughout January.
“The ongoing cold weather, combined with foggy conditions, posed a risk for students commuting to school.” - District Basic Education Officer, Rahul Panwar

The decision to close schools in Noida and the yellow alert in Delhi highlight the severe cold wave gripping North India, with potential risks for students and residents alike.
newTitle: Noida Schools Closed Due to Cold Wave; Delhi on Yellow Alert for Smog

BJP Accuses AAP of Voter List Discrepancy

  • They allege that AAP is manipulating the electoral process.
  • Calls for an investigation into the voter list have been made by BJP leaders.
'Kejriwal in love with bogus voters'

This controversy highlights ongoing tensions in Delhi's political landscape, as both parties prepare for upcoming electoral contests.

Noida: Schools closed for classes up to 8 due to cold wave - Hindustan Times
summary:
Noida Schools Closed for Classes Up to 8 Due to Cold Wave

Published on: Jan 02, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Due to severe cold wave conditions, schools in Noida will remain closed for classes up to eighth until further notice, affecting all educational boards.

  • Closure applies to all schools in Noida across state, CBSE, and ICSE boards.
  • Decision taken by district magistrate Manish Kumar Verma on health concerns for children.
  • Minimum temperature in Noida has dropped to around 8 degrees Celsius.
  • Schools must comply with the order or face strict action.
  • Weather predictions indicate ongoing cold conditions with likelihood of fog and mist from January 3 to 6.
“The severe cold intensifying over the last few days would cause problems for the children coming to school in the morning.” - Rahul Panwar, District Education Officer

The closure aims to ensure the safety of students during extreme weather, marking a continued response to fluctuating conditions in the region.
newTitle: Noida Schools Closed for Classes Up to 8 Due to Cold Wave

title: High-level meeting held; government shortlists Ekta Sthal, Vijay Ghat for Manmohan Singh’s memorial - The Indian Express
summary:
Government Shortlists Sites for Manmohan Singh's Memorial

Date: January 2, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

Top officials from the Ministry of Home Affairs and the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs met to identify potential sites for a memorial for former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh.

  • Two sites shortlisted: Ekta Sthal and Vijay Ghat.
  • Ekta Sthal is near Jawaharlal Nehru’s samadhi, while Vijay Ghat is near Mahatma Gandhi’s memorial.
  • The selection comes after the Congress party's request for a memorial following Singh's death on December 26.
  • Urban Development Secretary will inform Singh’s family about the proposed sites and establish a Trust for land allocation.
  • Former Congress leaders criticized the government's choice of location for Singh's last rites.
“The government’s choice of location had disrespected the former Prime Minister’s legacy.”

The announcement of the final memorial site is awaited, as public discourse continues regarding the appropriateness of the chosen locations.
newTitle: Government Shortlists Sites for Manmohan Singh's Memorial

title: DSP Gursher Sandhu dismissed for facilitating Lawrence Bishnoi interview - The Indian Express
summary:
DSP Gursher Sandhu Dismissed for Facilitating Gangster Interview

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

The Punjab Government has dismissed Deputy Superintendent of Police Gursher Singh Sandhu for facilitating the recording of an interview with notorious gangster Lawrence Bishnoi while he was in police custody.

  • Sandhu facilitated interviews with Bishnoi while he was held by the CIA in Kharar.
  • The interviews were aired on a private news channel in March 2023.
  • The dismissal orders were issued by the Secretary of the Department of Home Affairs.
  • Sandhu was under suspension since October 25, 2024, and evaded receiving a chargesheet.
  • The Punjab Public Service Commission approved Sandhu's dismissal under Article 311(2)(b) of the Indian Constitution.
“After careful consideration of the facts and circumstances, the state government is satisfied that Gursher Singh Sandhu has severely dented the image of the Punjab Police through his actions,” stated the dismissal order.

The decision to dismiss Sandhu is seen as a move to restore the credibility of the Punjab Police following significant misconduct by officers involved in the case.
newTitle: DSP Gursher Sandhu Dismissed for Facilitating Gangster Interview

title: 2 Malayali women killed, 10 injured in accident in Tamil Nadu - Onmanorama

Parents & Senior Citizens Act - Maintenance Tribunal Has Power To Order Eviction & Transfer Of Possession ... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Affirms Tribunal's Power to Evict Under Senior Citizens Act

Date & Source: 2025 LiveLaw (SC)

The Supreme Court has clarified that a Tribunal under the Maintenance and Welfare of Parents and Senior Citizens Act, 2007 has the power to order the eviction and transfer of possession.

  • The Court emphasized that without such power, the objectives of the 2007 Act would be defeated.
  • A mother sought to annul a gift deed to her son due to lack of maintenance.
  • The Tribunal's authority to transfer possession under Section 23 was reaffirmed.
  • The ruling supports the Act's goal of providing swift remedies to elderly citizens.
“It cannot be said that the Tribunals...cannot order possession to be transferred. This would defeat the purpose and object of the Act...”

The appeal was allowed, highlighting the importance of ensuring the rights of senior citizens in property matters.
newTitle: Supreme Court Affirms Tribunal's Power to Evict Under Senior Citizens Act

Kashmir inseparable part of India's soul: Home Minister Amit Shah - Greater Kashmir
Supreme Court questions petition alleging ‘favouritism’ in legal profession - The Hindu
summary:
Supreme Court questions petition alleging ‘favouritism’ in legal profession

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Supreme Court of India has challenged the claims of favoritism in the legal profession made by petitioner-advocate Mathews Nedumpara, who alleges that relatives of judges gain unfair advantages in attaining the 'senior advocate' designation.

  • The court questioned the basis of the petition, asking for evidence of judges' relatives being favored in designations.
  • Senior advocates hold pre-audience privileges in court as per the Advocates Act.
  • Nedumpara's petition aims to abolish the senior designations and the Collegium system to address elitism in the judiciary.
  • The court warned Nedumpara to reconsider the potentially defamatory claims in the petition.
  • The petitioners have four weeks to regroup and decide on their next steps.
“Creating a special class of advocates with special rights, privileges and status not available to ordinary advocates, is unconstitutional.” - Mathews Nedumpara

The Supreme Court's probing of the petition underscores the ongoing debate over equality and privilege within the legal system.
newTitle: Supreme Court scrutinizes petition on favoritism in legal profession

title: Union Carbide waste disposal in Pithampur won’t harm environment, says M.P. CM Mohan Yadav - The Hindu
summary:
Union Carbide waste disposal in Pithampur won’t harm environment, says M.P. CM Mohan Yadav

Date: January 02, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav stated that the disposal of toxic waste from the Union Carbide factory in Bhopal will not negatively impact the environment at its incineration site in Pithampur. This waste, weighing 337 tonnes, had been a concern due to past pollution fears.

  • The waste is set for disposal at a facility in Pithampur, 35 km from Indore.
  • The disposal is carried out following court directives using scientific methods.
  • 60% of the waste is soil, with 40% consisting of chemicals like naphthalene.
  • The incineration process has previously shown no environmental impact.
“For the last 40 years, the people of Bhopal have been living with this waste.” - M.P. CM Mohan Yadav

In conclusion, the Chief Minister reassured that the long-standing waste issue is being resolved with appropriate measures to ensure safety for the environment and residents.
newTitle: Union Carbide Waste Disposal in Pithampur Declared Safe by M.P. CM

title: 'Nothing Short of Jumlas': Kharge Slams PM Modi Over 'Economic Mess', Lists 7 Woes 'Destroying Every Citizen' - Times Now
summary:
Kharge Slams Modi Over Economic Crisis, Lists 7 Indicators

Date: Not specified. Source: Times Now News

Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge launched a scathing attack on Prime Minister Narendra Modi, accusing him and the BJP-led government of causing 'economic turmoil' that has severely affected ordinary citizens. Kharge said, "Modi government has NO economic solution for the economic turmoil it has created!".

Listing seven key indicators, Kharge showed the extent of economic stress on common citizens, including increased gold loans, slowed private consumption, low car sales, stagnant wage growth, high food inflation, eroded household savings, and high financial liabilities.

Conclusion: Kharge's criticism highlights the economic challenges faced by India under the Modi government.
newTitle: Kharge Slams Modi Over Economic Crisis, Lists 7 Indicators

title: Mira Bhayandar: 23-Year-Old Youth Killed After Argument Over Songs At New Years Party In Kashimira; - Free Press Journal
summary:
Fatal New Year's Dispute: 23-Year-Old Dies After Brawl Over Songs in Mumbai

Date & Source: Thursday, January 2, 2025 - Mid-Day

Introduction: A 23-year-old, Raja Pariyar, succumbed to injuries after being brutally assaulted during a New Year's party in Mumbai's Kashimira. The assault stemmed from a dispute over playing songs.

  1. Pariyar and a group of friends were celebrating New Year's Eve.
  2. A heated argument broke out between Pariyar and Ashish Jadhav over playing Bhojpuri numbers.
  3. Jadhav returned with five others and assaulted Pariyar and his friend Vipul Rai.
  4. Pariyar was rushed to the hospital but died after battling for life for nearly 24 hours.
  5. Three assailants, including the prime accused, were arrested, while three others remain at large.
The assault is said to be the fall-out of a petty tiff between two groups over playing songs.

Conclusion: The incident highlights the tragic consequences of trivial arguments escalating into violence.
newTitle: Fatal New Year's Dispute: 23-Year-Old Dies After Brawl Over Songs in Mumbai
